description: standing bearded man with long hair, wearing salmon-colored and white garments, bound at the wrists, gesturing with his hands, at right, accompanied by two guards--one with a long staff; two men, each wearing shades of red, seated on a tall platform, at left; blonde woman wearing white blouse behind turbaned seated man at left; soldier, seen from back, leaning on platform, at left, accompanied by a seated dog; three other male figures at center in background; red flag on pole at diagonal extending from column, at top center of image; dark interior
inscription:
Inscription and Label

on back of bottom frame member, in blue ink: [72497]
markings: on backing board: Fine Arts Gallery of San Diego loan label, two old paper labels (both probably in Italian) and other label fragments
title: St. Paul Before the Praetor
